alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Oldham (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Oldham and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 323 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coldstream, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Jefferson and southern Oldham Counties, including the following locations... Demplytown, Centerfield, Pewee Valley, Buckner, Floydsburg, Crestwood, Goshen, Ballardsville, Park Lake and Orchard Grass Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central Kentucky.
